description.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Semiarid Region committed to reducing child rights and gender and racial related inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for children and adolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Other General Services support to civil society

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Semiarid Region committed to reducing child rights and gender and racial related inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for children and adolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil.

description.narrative: UNICEF advances guarantee of rights of children and adolescents with 1,134 municipalities in the Semiarid Region of Brazil in the areas of education, survival and development, protection, and adolescent participation, and awarding UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval to 308 municipalities and giving special mention to an additional 597. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: By the end of 2012, 50% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region participating in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal 2009-2012, including the two forums and the social participation themes.

actual.value:
2016:Target achieved
51% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled and participated in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal 2009-2012, including the two forums and the social participation themes.

title.narrative: By the end of 2012, 15% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval Edition 2009-2012.

actual.value:
2016:Target achieved
22% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled were recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval – Edition 2009-2012.

title.narrative: By the end of 2013, 60% of all municipalities of the Semi-Arid Region enrolling in UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013 - 2016

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved. 76% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled in UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013 – 2016.

title.narrative: By the end of 2016,Percentage of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval Edition 2013-2016

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved By the end of 2016, 27% (308) of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval – Edition 2013-2016

title.narrative: Percentage of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region participating in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013-2016, including the two forums and the creation of the Adolescent Citizenship Group

actual.value: 2016:53% (597 of 1,134 municipalities) participated in all phases of the UNICEF Seal, edition 2013 – 2016, including two forums and the creation of Adolescent Citizenship Group. This percentage is considered quite high considering the economic and political turmoil of the country during this period.

title.narrative: Political Pact based on gender equality, equity and CRC principles for boys, girls, adolescents rights established with all Governors of Semiarid Region

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved By December 2016, pPolitical pacts were are in place in 90% of all states in SAB, focusing on one or more areas UNICEF programming
